dct_description_sm: With pagination: Tome VIII Pag. 87 (top right). With imprint: Par N. Sanson d'.Abbeville Geographe du Roy. Issued in his: Introduction à la Geographie. -- Paris, 1681.

With pagination: Tom. 3. Pag. 119. (top right). With imprint: Par N. Sanson d'.Abbeville Geographe du Roy. Issued in: Methode pour etudier la geographie ... avec un discours preliminaire sur l’ étude de cette Science ... Tome III. / [Nicolas Lenglet Dufresnoy]. -- Amsterdam: Aux dépens de la Compagnie. M.DCC.XVIII. (1718).
With pagination as in State 2, "Tom. 3. Pag. 119" (top right), imperfectly erased. With imprint: Par N. Sanson d’ Abbeville Geographe du Roy.
With changed title: AMERIQUE SEPTENTRIONALE. Imprint as in State 1: Par N. Sanson d'.Abbeville Geographe du Roy. With pagination: Tom II. Pag III. (top right).

With title and imprint: AMERICQVE SEPTENTRIONALE / Par N. Sanson d'.Abbeville Geographe du Roy. With pagination: Tom: I Pag: 490. (top right). Issued in: Introduction a l’histoire de L’Asia, de L’Afrique, et de L’Amerique / Par Mr. Bruzen La Martiniere. -- A Amsterdam: Chez Zacharie Chatelain, M.DCC.XXXV (1735).

In Italian. With changed title and imprint: AMERICA SETTENTRIONALE / di N. Sanson di Abbeville Geografo del Ré. Final ‘e’ in the title word Settentrionale placed in the upper right-hand corner of the cartouche. With pagination: Tom. III. pag. 266 (top right), with the 6 appearing as a corrected 4. Peninsula on mainland to north with its point labeled Carabas.
In Italian. With changed title and imprint: AMERICA SETTENTRIONAL / di N. Sanson di Abbeville Geografo del Re. With pagination: No. 9. (top right).
Par N. Sanson d’ Abbeville Geographe du Roy.
Wheat 51(State 2); Leighly 29; BN Sanson II F(1); Faupel's Americana 90(80); UCB(State 2); Nordenskiöld 3, 359(3) & 3, 713(13); Burden 324; Tom Rowlson correspondence, 1997.

In French. California as an island with indented northern coastline. Map left border cuts into California’s western coastline. Place names include C. d’Estiere, Nouvelle Albion, I. de Crintas, and C de S Lucas. Peninsula on mainland to north with its point labeled Conibas. Pictorial trees on mid-continent. Great Lakes are open-ended to west. Similar to Sanson’s earlier maps of the same title with engraving by D’Winter, Peyrounin, and Piscart, some with California’s northern coastline flat and some indented. Title cartouche of scrollwork, same as maps engraved by Peyrounin and D’Winter.
